page.title: 02HADHAM HALL
page.content: People have lived on this site for about 2,000 years. In Roman times the Celts had a small settlement here. Archaeological remains show that round huts belonging to a small farm were once situated where the school swimming pool now is. After 1066 the Norman Baud family developed an estate and foundations of their 15th century fortified manor house have been traced.In the early 1500's the Capel family bought Hadham Hall, and in the 1570's a new mansion was built. In the 1630's a great banquet hall was added,and the deer park extended eastwards to Bishop's Stortford. During the Civil War the Capels supported Charles I,and the Roundheads raided the hall in August 1642.At the end of the war in 1649 Lord Capel was executed by Parliament,but his son won
